It's pixelated, blurry and full of artifacts.

Is there a copy of this screener where the "watermark" was left alone? That blurry strip across the bottom of the screen is MUCH MUCH worse and distracting then the watermark itself.

I haven't downloaded from  except for a few other times. Don't get me wrong, the effort is very much appreciated and beside the blur, it is really good quality and is watchable. just for the record and meaning of terms. This is labeled as NO WATERMARK. That isn't quite true. The water mark cannot be removed, so it is still there but is covered by that blurry strip.

It should read, water mark is hidden under a blurry, annoying strip that also blurs the part of visual information that would be visable behind the watermark (which is a few words explaining this is a screener and not for retail use). . . or something like that.

Even if it could be removed, that watermark proves it is a screener and comes from an actual DVD. A DVD that isn't intended for sale to the public, but a DVD non the less.

I'll hold out for another screener where the watermark hasn't been tampered with. A solid BLACK strip may as well be laid on top of this watermark because the blurry strip doesn't let one see what is behind it any more then a solid black strip would.

If another screener with the intact watermark doesn't appear, I guess I'll be waiting for an upload of a Blu-Ray rip where a watermark isn't an issue what so ever.
Always glad and grateful for ones efforts, I just rather hold off for now.

As a native of Western US, this film is objectionable on the grounds that while wolves have been known to attack humans it is rare. This movie just gives the ranchers who want to exterminate them fodder.  The presence of wolves in the Rockies is worth the several hundred livestock animals that they kill each year and for whom the ranchers are well compensated. Predators are necessary.
